Top-3 Scripts:
au_841059: ffmpeg -framerate 60 -i input.png -i input.mp3 -vcodec libx264 -crf 20 -preset medium -acodec aac -vf scale=1280:-2,format=yuv420p output.mp4

#! /bin/bash
###################################################################
picture="input.jpg"  # Change this to the file name of your picture
###################################################################
for i in *.mp3; do
  ffmpeg -framerate 60 -f image2 -i $picture -i input.mp3 -vcodec libx264 -crf 20 -preset medium -acodec aac -vf scale=1280:-2,format=yuv420p "${i%.*}.".mp4
done

Explanations about Options.-acodec: Set the audio codec. This is an alias for "-codec:a".
Explanations about Options.-vf: Create the filtergraph specified by filtergraph and use it to filter the stream.
Explanations about Options.-vcodec: Set the video codec. This is an alias for "-codec:v".
Explanations about Options.-framerate:
Set the grabbing frame rate. Default is "ntsc", corresponding to a frame rate of
 "30000/1001".
Explanations about Options.-preset:
Configuration preset. This does some automatic settings based on the general type of
 the image.

Top-3 Similar Questions: su_1180108: Conditionally encode or copy audio stream using FFMpeg
Top-3 Scripts:
su_1180108: #!/bin/bash

audioformat=$(ffprobe -loglevel error -select_streams a:0 -show_entries stream=codec_name -of default=nw=1:nk=1 "$1")

if [ "$audioformat" = "aac" ]; then
  ffmpeg -i "$1" -c:v libx264 -c:a copy "${1%.*}_new.mkv"
else
  ffmpeg -i "$1" -c:v libx264 -c:a aac "${1%.*}_new.mkv"
fi

Explanations about Options.-loglevel: Set logging level and flags used by the library.

Answers.MP Summary: or  any situation  where  you want to make sure you're doing a clean install of your dependencies. It  can  be  significantly  faster  than  a  regular  npm  install  by  skipping   certain user-oriented  features.  It  is  also  more strict than a regular install, which can help catch errors or inconsistencies caused by the incrementally-installed  local  environments of most npm users. In short, the main differences between using npm install and npm ci are: · The project must have an existing package-lock.json or npm-shrinkwrap.json. · If dependencies in the package lock do not match those in package.json, npm ci will exit with an error, instead of updating the package lock. · npm ci can only install entire projects at a time:  individual  dependencies  cannot  be added with this command. · If  a  node_modules  is  already present, it will be automatically removed before npm ci begins its install. · It will  never  write  to  package.json  or  any  of  the  package-locks:  installs  are essentially frozen. See Also · npm help install · npm help package-locks April 2020                                  NPM-CI(1)

Answers.MP Summary: presumably creating or updating package.json and running any other initialization-related operations. The init command is transformed to a corresponding npx operation as follows: · npm init foo -> npx create-foo · npm init @usr/foo -> npx @usr/create-foo · npm init @usr -> npx @usr/create Any  additional  options  will  be passed directly to the command, so npm init foo --hello will map to npx create-foo --hello. If the initializer is omitted (by just calling npm init), init will fall  back  to  legacy init  behavior.  It  will  ask you a bunch of questions, and then write a package.json for you. It will attempt to make reasonable guesses based on  existing  fields,  dependencies, and  options selected. It is strictly additive, so it will keep any fields and values that were already set. You can also use -y/--yes to skip the questionnaire altogether.  If  you pass --scope, it will create a scoped package. au_841059: #! /bin/bash
###################################################################
picture="input.jpg"  # Change this to the file name of your picture
###################################################################
for i in *.mp3; do
  ffmpeg -framerate 60 -f image2 -i $picture -i input.mp3 -vcodec libx264 -crf 20 -preset medium -acodec aac -vf scale=1280:-2,format=yuv420p "${i%.*}.".mp4
done
